# **Contributing Guidelines**

Thank you for your interest in contributing to the OHDSI GIS Working Group! This guide will help you get started.

<br>

## **Code of Conduct**

All contributors are expected to follow the [OHDSI Code of Conduct](https://www.ohdsi.org/code-of-conduct/). We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment for all.

<br>

## **How to Contribute**

### **1. Join the Community**

Before contributing code, we encourage you to:

1. **Sign up for OHDSI Teams** ([registration link](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=lAAPoyCRq0q6TOVQkCOy1ZyG6Ud_r2tKuS0HcGnqiQZUQ05MOU9BSzEwOThZVjNQVVFGTDNZRENONiQlQCN0PWcu))
2. **Join the GIS Working Group** ([registration link](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=lAAPoyCRq0q6TOVQkCOy1ZyG6Ud_r2tKuS0HcGnqiQZUOVJFUzBFWE1aSVlLN0ozR01MUVQ4T0RGNyQlQCN0PWcu))
3. **Attend weekly meetings** - Fridays 10 AM US Eastern ([Teams link](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3af4d776830f504bf3827fe4309156a3c6%40thread.tacv2/1724707871947?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22a30f0094-9120-4aab-ba4c-e5509023b2d5%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22457ee911-94c1-4da2-8287-8d8a5a749931%22%7d))
4. **Introduce yourself** - Let us know your interests and background

### **2. Find Something to Work On**

#### **Good First Issues**
Check the [GitHub Project Board](https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26) for issues labeled:
- `good first issue` - Beginner-friendly tasks
- `help wanted` - Tasks needing contributors
- `documentation` - Documentation improvements

#### **Use Cases**
Review [open use cases](https://github.com/OHDSI/GIS/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22Use+Case%22) to see active research projects.

#### **Propose Your Own**
Have an idea? Great! Either:
- [Submit a use case](https://github.com/OHDSI/GIS/issues/new?assignees=&labels=Use+Case&projects=&template=use-case.yaml&title=%5BUse+Case%5D%3A+)
- Discuss in weekly meetings
- Post in the Teams channel

<br>

## **Development Workflow**

### **Step 1: Set Up Your Environment**

#### **Fork and Clone**
```bash
# Fork the repository on GitHub, then:
git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/REPOSITORY-NAME.git
cd REPOSITORY-NAME
git remote add upstream https://github.com/OHDSI/REPOSITORY-NAME.git
```

#### **Install Dependencies**

For **gaiaDb** and full stack (via gaiaDocker):
```bash
git clone https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDocker.git
cd gaiaDocker
docker compose --profile gaia up -d
```

See [Deployment Strategies](developer-deployment.html) for detailed setup.

### **Step 2: Create a Branch**

```bash
git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
# or
git checkout -b fix/your-bug-fix
```

**Branch Naming Conventions**:
- `feature/description` - New features
- `fix/description` - Bug fixes
- `docs/description` - Documentation
- `refactor/description` - Code refactoring

### **Step 3: Make Your Changes**

#### **Coding Standards**

**R Code (gaiaCore R client)**:
- Follow [tidyverse style guide](https://style.tidyverse.org/)
- Use roxygen2 for documentation
- Include unit tests for new functions
- Run `devtools::check()` before committing

**SQL (gaiaDb - core processing logic)**:
- Use lowercase for keywords
- Indent for readability
- Comment complex queries
- Include transformation documentation
- All geospatial processing stays in gaiaDb

**Documentation**:
- Update relevant .Rmd files
- Include examples where appropriate
- Update function documentation

#### **Testing**
- Add tests for new functionality
- Ensure existing tests pass
- Run full test suite before submitting PR

For R packages:
```r
devtools::test()
devtools::check()
```

#### **Documentation**
Update documentation as you code:

For **R functions**:
```r
#' Function Title
#'
#' Description of what the function does
#'
#' @param param1 Description of param1
#' @param param2 Description of param2
#' @return Description of return value
#' @examples
#' example_code()
#' @export
my_function <- function(param1, param2) {
  # implementation
}
```

Then run:
```r
devtools::document()
```

For **website/documentation**:
- Edit .Rmd files in `rmd/` directory
- Run `source('./build_site.R')` to rebuild

### **Step 4: Commit Your Changes**

```bash
git add .
git commit -m "Brief description of changes

More detailed explanation if needed:
- Bullet point 1
- Bullet point 2

Closes #123"
```

**Commit Message Guidelines**:
- First line: Brief summary (50 chars or less)
- Blank line
- Detailed explanation if needed
- Reference issues/PRs: `Closes #123`, `Relates to #456`

### **Step 5: Push and Create Pull Request**

```bash
git push origin feature/your-feature-name
```

Then on GitHub:
1. Click "Compare & pull request"
2. Fill out the PR template
3. Link related issues
4. Request reviewers

### **Step 6: Code Review**

- Respond to review comments
- Make requested changes
- Push updates (they'll appear in the PR automatically)
- Mark conversations as resolved when addressed

### **Step 7: Merge**

Once approved:
- Maintainer will merge your PR
- Delete your feature branch
- Pull latest changes from upstream

<br>

## **Pull Request Guidelines**

### **PR Title Format**
```
[Component] Brief description

Examples:
[gaiaCore] Add support for new data source format
[Docs] Update contributing guidelines
[gaiaDb] Fix spatial indexing bug
```

### **PR Description Template**

```markdown
## Description
Brief description of changes

## Related Issues
Closes #123
Relates to #456

## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Other (please describe)

## Testing
Describe testing performed:
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Manual testing completed

## Checklist
- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Tests added/updated
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] No breaking changes (or documented if necessary)
```

<br>

## **Working Group Coordination**

### **Weekly Meetings**

**Format** (2 minutes max per person):
1. **What did you complete?** - Last week's accomplishments
2. **What are you working on?** - Current tasks
3. **What's blocking you?** - Obstacles or help needed
4. **Discussion points** - Topics for group discussion (noted, discussed later)

### **Task Management**

We use GitHub Projects for task tracking:
- **Project Board**: https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26
- **Issues**: Task-oriented development work
- **Use Cases**: Research-driven requirements

**Issue Labels**:
- `Use Case` - Research use cases
- `good first issue` - Beginner-friendly
- `help wanted` - Need contributors
- `bug` - Bug reports
- `enhancement` - Feature requests
- `documentation` - Docs improvements
- `priority: high` - High priority items

### **Communication**

- **Weekly meetings**: Primary coordination
- **Teams channel**: Async discussion
- **GitHub issues**: Technical discussion, tracking
- **Email**: Working group announcements

<br>

## **Development Best Practices**

### **Privacy & Security**
- **Never commit** patient data or PHI
- **Never commit** credentials or API keys
- Use `.gitignore` for sensitive files
- Use environment variables for secrets

### **Data Handling**
- Work with synthetic data for development
- Document data provenance
- Respect data licenses
- Follow institutional policies

### **Code Quality**
- Write readable, maintainable code
- Comment complex logic
- Follow DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself)
- Refactor when appropriate

### **Version Control**
- Commit early and often
- Write meaningful commit messages
- Keep commits focused
- Don't commit broken code to main

<br>
